This translates into lots of exciting possibilities for product innovation, marketing insights, and supply-chain control. Authorization granted
Asana Auth AppAuth Logo Refresh token Access token expires at: %s No access token returned No refresh token returned Refresh token returned No ID token returned ID token returned View user info User profile picture Account ID (e.g. test@example.com) The Account ID is optional. If specified, it is transmitted as a login_hint parameter in the authorization request. Authorization options: Use browser: Browser app icon AppAuth heuristic selection "%1$s (custom tab)" Retry Not authorized Start authorization Reauthorize Sign out Access time has no defined expiry Access token has expired Authorization settings in use:
TabbedActivity Tab 1 Tab 2 Use PendingIntent\'s for completion
This button opens the QR scanner screen.
"1. The top left corner of this screen shows the count of scanned QR code. \n2. The top right corner of this screen shows the count of beacons found by beacon scanner. \n3. The 'Pause' button will pause the QR Scanner. \n4. The 'Resume' button will resume the QR Scanner. \n5. The 'Finish' button will stop QR scanner and system will starts processing QR data and Beacon data in background in below steps:
\n(a). QR data and Beacon data will be written to local database. \n(b). QR photo will be saved in default google drive folder. \n(c). QR data and Beacon data will be written to default spreadsheet with status of 'In Progress'. \n(d). QR data will be updated on corresponding Asana task. \n(e). After successfully completing above steps, system will change status of a QR data from 'In Progress' to 'Completed' in spreadsheet. \n6. The above process can be resumed by clicking in status column of a QR data in spreadsheet viewer, in case a QR data has not been processed successfully and its status in spreadsheet viewer is still 'In Progress' ."
This button opens the Beacon scanner screen.
"1 (a). Beacon scanner starts scanning automatically when app opens and stops scanning when app is closed. \n(b). Beacon Scanner scans continuously in background for the available beacons and shows them in a list in first tab 'Beacons'. \n(c). The dropdown on the top right corner can be used to filter the available beacons."
"2. Second tab 'BlackListed Beacons' shows the list of blacklisted beacons. \nInitially the blacklisted beacons list will be empty."
"3. A beacon can be added to blacklist by clicking on a beacon item from beacons list in first tab"
"4. When a beacon will be added to blacklist , it will be shown in blacklisted beacons list in second tab and this beacon will be removed from beacons list in first tab."
"5. A beacon can be removed from blacklist by clicking on a beacon item from blacklisted beacons list in second tab"
This button opens the Manage Spreadsheet screen. 1. First time user will need to choose a google account for saving and retrieving spreadsheets in google drive. "2 (a). System will show all spreadsheets created using app when user is logged in using a google account. \n(b). A spreadsheet can be created in root folder or inside specific folder. \n(c). A spreadsheet can be set as default for writing QR data and Beacon data by clicking on Star Icon."
"3. A new spreadsheet can be created using '+' icon in the bottom right corner of this screen." 4. A spreadsheet can be deleted by clicking on three vertical dots icon available in right side of spreadsheet name. 5. Default spreadsheet (Spreadsheet for saving QR and Beacon data) name will be shown on top right corner of the screen. Clicking on which a pop-up will be shown that will show the path of default spreadsheet in google drive
"6(a). Spreadsheet data can be checked by clicking on a spreadsheet icon from list. \n(b). A spreadsheet has two sheets- 'QR Sheet' for writing QR data and 'Bluetooth Sheet' for writing beacons data."
7. On clicking in a cell, its data preview can be seen in bottom bar. 8. QR data uploading process can be resumed by clicking in status column of a QR data in QR sheet page of spreadsheet viewer. 9. When QR data uploading process will be started, it will be notified by a message.
This button opens the Manage Drive screen.
1. First time user will need to choose a google account for saving and retrieving photos in a google drive folder.
2. First time user will also need to allow permission for managing files and folders on google drive.
"3(a). System will show all folders created using app when user is logged in using a google account. \n(b). A folder can be set as default folder for saving QR photos by clicking on Star Icon available on folder icon."
"4. Default folder (Google drive folder for QR photo) name will be shown on top right corner of the screen. Clicking on which a pop-up will be shown that will show the path of default spreadsheet in google drive
"5. A new folder can be created using '+' icon in the bottom right corner of this screen."
6. A folder/photo can be deleted by clicking on three vertical dots icon available in right side of folder/photo title.
7. System will show all QR photos saved in a folder by clicking on folder icon.
8. Full size preview of a QR photo can be viewed by clicking on a QR photo.
This button opens the Asana Authorization screen.
"1. First time user will need to click on 'START AUTHORIZATION' button to start Asana authorization process. "
"2. System will then start browser session for making authorization request on Asana."
"3. Browser session will load Asana login web page. User can login using existing Asana credentials or create a new account."
"4. User may also use google account option for logging in to Asana"
"5. When user is authorized on Asana, a new screen having user name and email id will be shown."
This button opens the QR scanner screen.
"1. The top left corner of this screen shows the count of scanned QR code. \n2. The 'Pause' button will pause the QR Scanner. \n3. The 'Resume' button will resume the QR Scanner. \n4. The 'Finish' button will stop QR scanner and system will starts processing QR data in below steps:
\n(a). System will search for the tasks related to each QR code scanned in the same workspace logged in. \n(b). A new project will be created in logged-in workspace and default team selected in asana home screen. Project name will be in form of YYYYMMDDn, where YYYYMMDD is the date, e.g., 20210302, and "n" is appended just in case this function is run more than once in a day. \n(c). All tasks will be added to this newly created project.
